Wisdom: الذُّلُّ فِي [إِلَى‏] مَسْأَلَةِ النَّاسِ
enWisdom: Humiliation [and disgrace] is in asking from people

Wisdom: الْمَسْأَلَةُ مِفْتَاحُ الْفَقْرِ
enWisdom: Begging is the key to poverty

Wisdom: الْجُوعُ خَيْرٌ مِنْ ذُلِّ الْخُضُوعِ
enWisdom: Hunger is better than the humiliation of subjugation

Wisdom: السُّؤَالُ يُضْعِفُ لِسَانَ الْمُتَكَلِّمِ وَيَكْسِرُ قَلْبَ الشُّجَاعِ الْبَطَلِ وَيُوقِفُ الْحُرَّ الْعَزِيزَ مَوْقِفَ الْعَبْدِ الذَّلِيلِ وَيُذْهِبُ بَهَاءَ الْوَجْهِ وَيَمْحَقُ الرِّزْقَ
enWisdom: Begging weakens the tongue of the speaker, breaks the heart of the courageous hero, puts the free honourable one in the position of a humbled slave, takes away the radiance of one’s face and wipes out one’s sustenance

Wisdom: بَذْلُ مَاءِ الْوَجْهِ فِي الطَّلَبِ أَعْظَمُ مِنْ قَدْرِ الْحَاجَةِ وَإِنْ عَظُمَتْ وَأُنْجِحَ فِيهَا الطَّلَبُ
enWisdom: Sacrificing one’s dignity by begging is greater [in value] than the extent of one’s need, even if it is great and even if it is granted

Wisdom: الْمَسْأَلَةُ طَوْقُ الْمَذَلَّةِ تَسْلُبُ الْعَزِيزَ عِزَّهُ وَالْحَسِيبَ حَسَبَهُ
enWisdom: Begging is the collar of humiliation, it takes the honour away from the honourable and the stature away from the noble

Wisdom: أَشَدُّ مِنَ الْمَوْتِ طَلَبُ الْحَاجَةِ مِنْ غَيْرِ أَهْلِهَا
enWisdom: Seeking one’s need from he who is not worthy [of being asked] is harder than death

Wisdom: إِنَّ قَدْرَ السُّؤَالِ أَكْثَرُ مِنْ قِيمَةِ النَّوَالِ فَلَا تَسْتَكْثِرُوا مَا أَعْطَيْتُمُوهُ فَإِنَّهُ لَنْ يُوَازِيَ قَدْرَ السُّؤَالِ
enWisdom: Verily the value of asking is greater than the worth of what is given, so do not regard that which you give as much, for it will never be equal to the humiliation of asking

Wisdom: آفَةُ الطَّلَبِ عَدَمُ النَّجَاحِ
enWisdom: The bane of asking [others] is lack of success [in getting what one asks for]

Wisdom: حُسْنُ الْيَأْسِ أَجْمَلُ مِنْ ذُلِّ الطَّلَبِ
enWisdom: The virtue of loss of hope [in others] is better than the humiliation of asking [for their help]

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْإِلْحَاحِ مَحْرَمَةً
enWisdom: Importunity is enough as a [reason for] deprivation

Wisdom: كَثْرَةُ الْإِلْحَاحِ تُوجِبُ الْمَنْعَ
enWisdom: Excessive importunity leads to refusal

Wisdom: كَثْرَةُ إِلْحَاحِ الرَّجُلِ تُوجِبُ حِرْمَانَهُ
enWisdom: The excessive importunity of a man leads to his deprivation

Wisdom: مَنْ سَأَلَ مَا لَا يَسْتَحِقُّ قُوبِلَ بِالْحِرْمَانِ
enWisdom: One who asks for that which he does not deserve is faced with deprivation

Wisdom: مَنْ تَكَرَّرَ سُؤَالُهُ لِلنَّاسِ ضَجَرُوهُ
enWisdom: One who repeats his request to the people, they get irritated by him

Wisdom: مَنْ طَلَبَ مَا فِي أَيْدِي النَّاسِ حَقَّرُوهُ
enWisdom: Whoever seeks that which is in the possession of people, they debase him [for it]

Wisdom: مَنْ أَلَحَّ فِي سُؤَالِهِ دَعَا إِلَى حِرْمَانِهِ
enWisdom: One who is importunate in his asking invites his own deprivation

Wisdom: وَجْهُكَ مَاءٌ جَامِدٌ يُقَطِّرُهُ السُّؤَالُ فَانْظُرْ عِنْدَ مَنْ تُقَطِّرُهُ
enWisdom: Your countenance is like frozen water that is melted by asking; so [be careful and] consider whose presence you are melting it in

Wisdom: لَا ذُلَّ كَالطَّلَبِ
enWisdom: There is no humiliation like asking [for something from others]

Wisdom: يَنْبَغِي لِلْعَاقِلِ أَنْ يَكْتَسِبَ بِمَالِهِ الْمَحْمَدَةَ وَيَصُونَ نَفْسَهُ عَنِ الْمَسْأَلَةِ
enWisdom: It behoves the intelligent person to earn praise through his wealth and to preserve himself from asking others
